result.execSummary:
The defendant John M Breiling was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs paid in full. Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Case called at 2:47 PM 
District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant John M Breiling in court with attorney Jonathan Carver Smith.  
Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.
Count 1 is dismissed and read-in.
Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to Count 2.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of Count 2.
State makes sentencing recommendations.
Defense makes sentencing recommendations.

COUNT 2
Court orders the following:
Fine:  $578.00
Dr God Surcharge:  $10.00
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid in 30-days.
Penalty:  Entry of a Civil Judgment

Defense counsel requests another plea/sentencing date.  Court resets matter for plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Smith requests a plea and sentencing date in about 60 days.  Court sets matter for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
